title: The Fall of Man
summary: Genesis 3 tells how sin entered the world when Adam and Eve disobeyed God. It shows the consequences of sin and the beginning of God’s plan to rescue humanity.

faq.question: Why did God allow the serpent in the garden?
faq.answer: God gives us free will. The serpent's presence gave Adam and Eve a choice to trust or disobey Him.

faq.question: What does the 'fruit' represent?
faq.answer: The fruit represents the decision to choose our own way over God’s way — disobedience to God's command.

faq.question: What is the hope in this chapter?
faq.answer: Even after the fall, God promises a future Savior who will crush evil (Genesis 3:15).
